Annotation.String: A metric definition.
Abstract metric definition.
The interval until the next event.
The value shall indicate the applicability of the metric value for performing calculations.
Arithmetic on corresponding metric values makes no sense.

It is reasonable to sum corresponding metric values over many instances. For example, if each backup job backs up 27,000 files on average, then it makes sense to say that 100 backup jobs processed 2,700,000 files.

It does not make sense to sum corresponding metric values over many instances. An example would be a metric that measures the queue length when a job arrives at a server. If the average queue length when each job arrives is 33, it does not make sense to say that the queue length for 100 jobs is 3300. It does make sense to say that the mean is 33.
The data type of the related metric values.
The value shall be the data type of the related metric values as defined by the Odata Edm.xsd schema.
Specifies the type of metric provided.
The value of this property shall designate the type of metric provided.

The metric is a counter metric. Such counters, also known as rollover counters, can be used to count the number of network errors or the number of transactions processed. The only way for a client application to keep track of wrap arounds is to retrieve the value of the counter in appropriately short intervals or to subscribe for indications on wrap.

The metric is a counter metric that shall have a non-negative integer value that increases monotonically until reaching the maximum representable number and then wrap around and start increasing from 0.
The metric is a gauge metric. These have integer or float values that can increase and decrease arbitrarily.

The metric is a gauge metric that shall have an integer or float value that may increase and decrease arbitrarily. A gauge shall wrap when reaching the minimum or maximum representable number, instead, the value sticks at that number.
The metric is a numeric value. A numeric value is a real number present in float format.
The value of the metric shall be a real number with a float format.
The metric has discrete values. These typically indicate current states, as opposed to values.
The metric values shall indicate discrete states.
The metric is implemented as a physical sensor.
The metric is implemented by applying a calculation on the readings from one or more physical sensors.
The metric is implemented by applying a calculation on one more more metric properties. The CalculationAlgorithm property specifies the algorithm.
The metric is implemented as digital meter.
A definition of a metric.
A programatic definition for a metric, i.e., a definition template containing meta data about a new metric. Values of the defined metric shall be represented as metric values.
Specifies how the sensor is implemented.
The value of this property shall designate how the sensor is implemented.
Caculatability of this Metric.
The value shall define the caculatability of this metric.
Units of measure for this metric.
The value shall be consistent with the case sensitive Unified Code for Units of Measure as defined at http://unitsofmeasure.org/ucum.html. Note: the units of measure is not covered in UCUM.
The data type of the corresponding metric values.
The value shall specify the data type of the corresponding metric values.
Indicates linear or non-linear values.

The value shall specify that the corresponding metric values shall be linear or non-linear. Performance metrics are an example of linear metrics. Examples of non-linear metrics include error codes or operational states. Linear metrics may be compared using a greater than relation.
Specifies the type of metric provided.
The value of this property shall designate the type of metric provided.
Wildcards used to replace values in AppliesTo and Calculates metric property arrays.
The property shall contain an array of wildcards and their replacements strings, which are to appliced to the AppliesTo or Caculates array.
A collection of URI for the properties on which this metric definition is defined.

Each value may contain one or more Wildcard names enclosed in curly braces. Wildcard value entries shall be substituted for each Wildcard name found. If two or more wild names are found, the same Wildcard index is used for each in one substitution pass. After substituting the WildCard values entries, each value shall be a URI for a property in a resource that matches a property declaration in the corresponding MetricDefinition.
After processing Wildcard replacement values, each value shall resolve to an OData conformant URI to a property in an entity.
Specifies the resource properties (metric) which are characterized by this definition.
The value of each list element share be a reference to the resource property which is characterized by this definition.
Specifies the physical context of the sensor.
The value of this property shall designate the physical context of the sensor.
This property represents the type of sensor that this resource represents.
The value of this property shall describe the type of sensor.
This property specifies the time interval between when a metric or sensor reading is updated.
The value of the property shall specify the time interval between metric or sensor reading updates. The value shall be in the format specified in ISO 8601.
This array property specifies possible values of a discrete metric.
The values of the property shall specify the possible values of the discrete metic. This property shall have values when the MetricType property has the value 'Discrete'.
Number of significant digits in the Reading described by MetricProperties field.
The value of the property shall specify the number of significant digits in the metric reading described by MetricProperties field.. A value shall not be present if MetricType is Discrete.
Estimated percent error of measured vs. actual values.
The value of the property shall be the percent error +/- of the measured vs. actual values. A value shall not be present if MetricType is Discrete.
Specifies the calibration offset added to the Reading to obtain an accurate value.

The value shall be the value which has been added to the Reading value to make the reading more accurate. The value shall have the units specified in the property Units. A value shall not be present if MetricType is Discrete.
Accuracy of the timestamp.
The value of property shall specify the expected + or - variability of the timestamp. The format of the property shall conformant to ISO 8601 duration format.
Minimum value for Reading.

If present, the value shall indicate the lowest possible value for a related MetricValue. The value shall have the units specified in the property Units. A value shall not be present if MetricType is Discrete.
Maximum value for Reading.

If present, the value shall indicate the highest possible value for a related MetricValue. The value shall have the units specified in the property Units. A value shall not be present if MetricType is Discrete.
This property specifies the calculation which is performed on a source metric to obtain the metric being defined.
The value of this property shall specify the calculation which is performed on a source metric to obtain the metric being defined.
This property specifies the time interval over which a calculated metric algorithm is performed.
The value of the property shall specify the time interval over which a calculated metric algorithm is performed. The value shall be in the format specified in ISO 8601.
The metric property used as the input into the calculation.
This property reference the metric property used in a calcuation.
The metric property used to store the results of the calculation.
This property shall reference the metric property which the results of the calcuation are placed.
The name of Wildcard.
This property shall contain a name for a Wildcard.
An array of values to substitute for the wildcard.
This property shall contain then the server shall substitute. Each not empty value shall be substituted for the wildcard.
The metric is calculated as the average over a sliding time interval.
The metric shall be calculated as the average over a sliding time interval. The time interval shall be the value of the CalculationTimeInterval property.
The metric is calculated as the maximum value of a source metric over during a time interval.

The metric shall be calculated as the maximum of a source metric over a sliding time interval. The time interval shall be the value of the CalculationTimeInterval property. The source metric shall be specified in the AppliesTo.SourceMetricProperty property.
The metric is calculated as the minimum value of a source metric over during a time interval.

The metric shall be calculated as the minimum of a source metric over a sliding time interval. The time interval shall be the value of the CalculationTimeInterval property. The source metric shall be specified in the AppliesTo.SourceMetricProperty property.
